concise_definition: n. 噪音, 声音, 响声

definitions.explanation_en: Unwanted or unpleasant sounds that are disruptive, distracting, or interfere with communication or concentration.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指令人不悦、干扰性或分散注意力的声响，通常影响交流或专注。
definitions.example_en: The construction noises outside made it impossible to sleep.
definitions.example_cn: 外面的施工噪音让人根本无法入睡。

definitions.explanation_en: Any sound, especially one that is vague, indistinct, or lacks meaningful content, often used metaphorically to describe irrelevant information.
definitions.explanation_cn: 泛指任何声音，尤其指模糊不清、无明确含义的声音，常用于比喻无意义的信息或杂音。
definitions.example_en: The political debate was just a lot of noise without any real substance.
definitions.example_cn: 这场政治辩论不过是空洞的喧嚣，毫无实质内容。

definitions.explanation_en: Electrical or signal interference that distorts or degrades the quality of a transmission, especially in audio, video, or data systems.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在音频、视频或数据系统中干扰并降低传输质量的电信号或电磁干扰。
definitions.example_en: There was too much noise on the phone line, so we couldn't hear each other clearly.
definitions.example_cn: 电话线路干扰太大，我们听不清对方的声音。

comparison.analysis: “Sound” (声音) 是中性词，泛指任何可听的声波，无论是否悦耳或有用。而 “noise” 特指令人不悦或干扰性的声音，带有主观负面评价。例如，音乐是 sound，但若音量过大则成为 noise。
“Static” (静电干扰/杂音) 是一种特定类型的电子噪声，通常表现为持续的嘶嘶声或噼啪声，常见于收音机或电视信号中。它是 “noise” 的一种子类型，但更具体地指向技术性干扰，而非泛指环境声响。
“Clamor” (喧闹声) 强调由多人或多种声音共同制造的嘈杂、激烈、持续的声响，常带有情绪色彩（如抗议、欢呼）。它比 “noise” 更具动态性和群体性，而 “noise” 可以是单一、微弱或机械的声响。
